page.title: 02BINEGAR AND GURNEY SLADE
page.content: Binegar and Gurney Slade are two old villages joined into one by modern building. They are in dairy farming countryside.Gurney Slade has limestone quarries some of which have closed. It has a community many of whose parents and grandparents were born in the surrounding area. Most people now have to travel away from the village for employment.There is a primary school with 56 children when they are 11 they go on to secondary school in nearby towns.Local events are centred in the villages with a gymkhana and fetes in aid of the church and school.Social life is centred round the two public houses with skittles and darts teams. There are many clubs for young and old. Binegar is a quiet rural area while Gurney slade is busier with main road,quarry traffic and two village shops.
